info.title: WebApplicationFirewallManagement
info.description: APIs to manage web application firewall rules.

get.description: List all network security perimeters in a subscription.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: An optional query parameter which specifies the maximum number of records to be returned by the server.

parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: SkipToken is only used if a previous operation returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a skipToken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

default.description: An unexpected error response.

get.description: List network security perimeters in a resource group.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: An optional query parameter which specifies the maximum number of records to be returned by the server.

parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: SkipToken is only used if a previous operation returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a skipToken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

default.description: An unexpected error response.

get.description: Gets the specified network security perimeter by the name.

parameters.name: networkSecurityPerimeterName
parameters.description: The name of the network security perimeter.

default.description: An unexpected error response.

put.description: Creates or updates a Network Security Perimeter.

parameters.name: networkSecurityPerimeterName
parameters.description: The name of the network security perimeter.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameter supplied to create or update the network security perimeter.

default.description: An unexpected error response.

patch.description: Patch Tags for a Network Security Perimeter.

parameters.name: networkSecurityPerimeterName
parameters.description: The name of the network security perimeter.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameter supplied to the network security perimeter.

default.description: An unexpected error response.

parameters.name: networkSecurityPerimeterName
parameters.description: The name of the network security perimeter.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Deletes the resource even if it contains any child associations.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: A link to the status monitor

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

default.description: An unexpected error response.

204.description: Request successful. The resource does not exist.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: OK - Returns the list of NSP resource associations.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.
Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the list of resources that are onboarded with NSP. These resources can be associated with a network security perimeter

200.description: Request successful. Returns the list of resources that are onboarded with network security perimeter feature.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters for NSP access rule reconcile

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the specified NSP link resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates NSP link resource.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters that hold the NspLink resource to be created/updated.

200.description: Updated - Existing NspLink resource is updated. Returns the resource.

201.description: Create - Returns the NspLink resource created.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

204.description: Request successful. The resource does not exist.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists the NSP Link resources in the specified network security perimeter.

200.description: OK - Returns the list of NSP link resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the specified NSP linkReference resource.

200.description: OK - Returns the NSP linkReference resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

204.description: Request successful. The resource does not exist.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists the NSP LinkReference resources in the specified network security perimeter.

200.description: OK - Returns the list of NSP linkReference resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.
Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates NSP logging configuration.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters that hold the NspLoggingConfiguration to be created/updated.

200.description: Updated - Existing NspLoggingConfiguration is updated. Returns the logging configuration.

201.description: Create - Returns the NspLoggingConfiguration resource created.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

204.description: Request successful. The logging configuration does not exist.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: OK - Returns the list of NSP logging configuration.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the operation status for the given operation id.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the Nsp operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the list of service tags supported by NSP. These service tags can be used to create access rules in NSP.

200.description: Request successful. Returns the list of service tags supported by NSP.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

NetworkSecurityPerimeterListResult.description: The response of a NetworkSecurityPerimeter list operation.

value.description: The NetworkSecurityPerimeter items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the scope assignment resource.

perimeterGuid.description: perimeter guid of the network security perimeter.

properties.description: Properties of the NSP access rule.

NspAccessRuleListResult.description: The response of a NspAccessRule list operation.

value.description: The NspAccessRule items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the scope assignment resource.

direction.description: Direction that specifies whether the access rules is inbound/outbound.

fullyQualifiedDomainNames.description: Outbound rules in fully qualified domain name format.

networkSecurityPerimeters.description: Rule specified by the perimeter id.

emailAddresses.description: Outbound rules in email address format. This access rule type is currently unavailable for use.

phoneNumbers.description: Outbound rules in phone number format. This access rule type is currently unavailable for use.

serviceTags.description: Inbound rules of type service tag. This access rule type is currently unavailable for use.

properties.description: Properties of the NSP resource association.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the resource  association resource.

privateLinkResource.description: The PaaS resource to be associated.

profile.description: Profile id to which the PaaS resource is associated.

hasProvisioningIssues.description: Specifies if there are provisioning issues

NspLink.description: The network security perimeter link resource

properties.description: Properties of the network security perimeter link resource.

NspLinkListResult.description: The response of a NspLink list operation.

value.description: The NspLink items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the NSP Link resource.

autoApprovedRemotePerimeterResourceId.description: Perimeter ARM Id for the remote NSP with which the link gets created in Auto-approval mode. It should be used when the NSP admin have Microsoft.Network/networkSecurityPerimeters/linkPerimeter/action permission on the remote NSP resource.

remotePerimeterGuid.description: Remote NSP Guid with which the link gets created.

remotePerimeterLocation.description: Remote NSP location with which the link gets created.

localInboundProfiles.description: Local Inbound profile names to which Inbound is allowed. Use ['*'] to allow inbound to all profiles.

localOutboundProfiles.description: Local Outbound profile names from which Outbound is allowed. In current version, it is readonly property and it's value is set to ['*'] to allow outbound from all profiles. In later version, user will be able to modify it.

remoteInboundProfiles.description: Remote Inbound profile names to which Inbound is allowed. Use ['*'] to allow inbound to all profiles. This property can only be updated in auto-approval mode.

remoteOutboundProfiles.description: Remote Outbound profile names from which Outbound is allowed. In current version, it is readonly property and it's value is set to ['*'] to allow outbound from all profiles. In later version, user will be able to modify it.

description.description: A message passed to the owner of the remote NSP link resource with this connection request. In case of Auto-approved flow, it is default to 'Auto Approved'. Restricted to 140 chars.

NspLinkReference.description: The network security perimeter linkReference resource

properties.description: Properties of the network security perimeter linkReference resource.

NspLinkReferenceListResult.description: The response of a NspLinkReference list operation.

value.description: The NspLinkReference items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

accessRulesVersion.description: Version number that increases with every update to access rules within the profile.

diagnosticSettingsVersion.description: Version number that increases with every update to diagnostic settings within the profile.

properties.description: Properties of the NSP access rule.

value.description: Gets a page of NSP access rule

nextLink.description: Gets the URL to get the next page of results.

NspAccessRuleListResult.description: Result of the request to list NSP access rules. Contains a list of NSP access rules and a URL link to get the next set of results.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the NSP LinkReference resource.

remotePerimeterResourceId.description: Perimeter ARM Id for the remote NSP with which the link is created.

remotePerimeterGuid.description: Remote NSP Guid with which the link is created.

remotePerimeterLocation.description: Remote NSP location with which the link gets created.

localInboundProfiles.description: Local Inbound profile names to which Inbound is allowed. Use ['*'] to allow inbound to all profiles.

localOutboundProfiles.description: Local Outbound profile names from which Outbound is allowed. In current version, it is readonly property and it's value is set to ['*'] to allow outbound from all profiles. In later version, user will be able to modify it.

remoteInboundProfiles.description: Remote Inbound profile names to which Inbound is allowed. ['*'] value implies inbound is allowed to all profiles at remote perimeter. This property can only be updated from corresponding link resource present in remote perimeter.

remoteOutboundProfiles.description: Remote Outbound profile names from which Outbound is allowed. ['*'] value implies outbound is allowed from all profiles at remote perimeter. This property can only be updated from corresponding link resource present in remote perimeter.

description.description: A message sent by the remote NSP link admin for connection request. In case of Auto-approved flow, it is default to 'Auto Approved'.

status.description: The NSP linkReference state. It cannot be changed if link is created in auto-approval mode.

properties.description: Properties of the NSP logging configuration.

NspLoggingConfigurationListResult.description: The response of a NspLoggingConfiguration list operation.

value.description: The NspLoggingConfiguration items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

enabledLogCategories.description: The log categories to enable in the NSP logging configuration.

version.description: The version of the NSP logging configuration.

localInboundProfiles.description: Local Inbound profile names to which Inbound is allowed. Use ['*'] to allow inbound to all profiles.

localOutboundProfiles.description: Local Outbound profile names from which Outbound is allowed. In current version, it is readonly property and it's value is set to ['*'] to allow outbound from all profiles. In later version, user will be able to modify it.

remoteInboundProfiles.description: Remote Inbound profile names to which Inbound is allowed. ['*'] value implies inbound is allowed to all profiles at remote perimeter. This property can only be updated from corresponding link resource present in remote perimeter.

remoteOutboundProfiles.description: Remote Outbound profile names from which Outbound is allowed. ['*'] value implies outbound is allowed from all profiles at remote perimeter. This property can only be updated from corresponding link resource present in remote perimeter.
